name: Pad Thai
details: Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, shrimp, tofu, eggs, and bean sprouts. It is often served with crushed peanuts, lime wedges, and chili flakes.

name: Tom Kha Gai
details: Tom Kha Gai is a coconut milk-based soup made with chicken, lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. It is often served with rice and is a popular dish in Thailand.

name: Green Papaya Salad
details: Green Papaya Salad, also known as Som Tam, is a spicy salad made with shredded green papaya, tomatoes, green beans, and chili peppers. It is often served with sticky rice and is a popular street food in Thailand.

name: Massaman Curry
details: Massaman Curry is a mild curry dish made with chicken, potatoes, peanuts, and a blend of spices including cinnamon and star anise. It is often served with rice and is a popular dish in Southern Thailand.

name: Pad Kra Pao
details: Pad Kra Pao is a stir-fry dish made with minced pork, chicken, or beef, stir-fried with Thai basil, garlic, and chili peppers. It is often served with rice and a fried egg.

name: Khao Soi
details: Khao Soi is a Northern Thai noodle soup made with chicken, curry paste, coconut milk, and egg noodles. It is typically garnished with crispy noodles, pickled mustard greens, and lime wedges.

name: Som Tum Tod
details: Som Tum Tod is a fried version of the popular Thai salad Papaya Salad. It is made with shredded green papaya, carrots, and green beans, coated in a crispy batter and served with a sweet and sour sauce.

name: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai
details: Gaeng Keow Wan Gai, also known as Green Curry Chicken, is a popular Thai dish made with green curry paste, coconut milk, chicken, and vegetables such as eggplant and green beans. It is often served with rice.

name: Pad Kra Pao
details: Pad Kra Pao is a stir-fry dish made with minced pork, chicken, or beef, stir-fried with Thai basil, garlic, and chili peppers. It is often served with rice and a fried egg.
